Column Comment.0: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes andbounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.
Column Comment.1: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.2: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.
Column Comment.3: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: OVERLAP SIZE: the size of the overlap between two parcels.
Column Comment.8: OVERLAP SIZE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: Usually acres or hectares
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: SPATIAL CROSS REFERENCE TYPE: the reason why the spatial descriptions arerelated. Could be a spatial overlap, a business relationship etc.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
